main event: A UFO sighting occurred over Utah on February 4, 1957, involving a ground-radar and visual observation of a single object moving west for 3-4 seconds.
interesting points: The sighting was initially thought to be a passing jet or similar object, but the evaluation concluded with insufficient data.
The object was described as a round, still red object that seemed to be illuminated from the inside, not like a reflection.
The witness was on a TWA Constellation flight and observed the UFO below the aircraft, disappearing from view after 3-4 seconds.
The witness considered writing to TWA about the sighting but never did, and did not report it until years later.
The witness debunked the idea of the object being a UFO by comparing it to a side view of a jet, but still expressed curiosity about the incident.
sighted object: Single round, still red object illuminated from the inside
witnesses: Single witness on a TWA Constellation flight
